body.p: Eland Mr. and Mrs. A. J. James visited over at Shawano and OcU where then daughter's family lives. Mr. and Mrs. John Rettig and Mr and Mrs. Emerson Cottrell visited Adam Rettig in Wausau Memorial hospital Sunday. Mrs, W. D. Brown left for Appleton where she will carts for her mother who is ill. Mr. and Mrs. M. J. Pickering of Mattoon spent Sunday in the Pickering home. Mrs. William Lipke and daughters of Bowler spent Sunday with Eland friends. Miss Hilda Helig of Mendota visited her home Tuesday and her father! at Memorial Hospital. Kermit Schfaspke has returned from' Milwaukee. Irvin Wextfahl returned to Bowler where he resumed teaching. He is: feeling pretty fair. Mr. and Mrs. Joe Stoltz and daughter Shirley moved to their home at Rinjrie Momlav. They spent the winter in the Otto Meyer home. Mrs Herman Lemke and daughter LaYerne and Mrs. Clara Schnranks from Birnamwood spent Thursday with Mrs. Felix Konkol. Mr. and Mrs. H. Piehl and Mr. and Mrs. Oerald Owen and daughter spent Sunday with relatives at Seymour. Mrs. L. Bice entertained her bridge dub Tuesday evening. W. E. Sehoepke was pleasantly sur- prised hy a group of 14 friends Sunday evening in honor of his birthday. Curds were plaved and prizes were awaided to Mr. August Warning and Mrs. A. Bohlman and A. Rohiman and William Frank Mr. and Mrs. Felix Konkol and family were dinner guests of Mr. and Mrs. Btadley Monday The Ladisss Aid of Zions Lutheran chinch is having their parish home modeled and also redecorated. Miss Sell of Tigerton was a guest of Miss Laura Way over the weekend. Hale V an Horen. Norman Koerner and Mrs. J, F. Franklin drove to Milwaukee Monday morning and returned Tuesday night.
